subject: Swimming
Olympic Games (2008)
Steroids
lead_paragraph: Swimmer Jessica Hardy had her two-year suspension for a failed drug test reduced to one year by the American Arbitration Association, allowing her to return to competition this summer. Hardy, 22, withdrew from the United States Olympic team last August, nearly a month after she tested positive for a low level of clenbuterol, a prohibited anabolic agent, at the Olympic swimming trials. Hardy qualified for the Beijing Olympics in two individual events — the 100-meter breaststroke and 50 freestyle — and the 400 free relay. Hardy’s suspension ends July 31, which is after the United States team selection meet for the world championships in Rome.
